title: Functions to Analyze Mid Infrared Spectra of Peat Samples
text: ‘irpeat’ R package contains simple functions analyze infrared spectra peat samples. functions may also work organic matter samples general. Provided functions analyzing infrared spectra peat : Computation several humification indices. Klason lignin mass fraction (following Hodgkins et al. (2018) Teickner Knorr (2022)). Holocellulose mass fraction (following Hodgkins et al. (2018) Teickner Knorr (2022)). Peat electron accepting capacity (following Teickner, Gao, Knorr (2022)). Peat electron donating capacity (following Teickner, Gao, Knorr (2022)).

title: Functions to Analyze Mid Infrared Spectra of Peat Samples
text: can install ‘irpeat’ GitHub using R via: ‘irpeat’ relies R package ‘ir’ handling infrared spectra.

title: Functions to Analyze Mid Infrared Spectra of Peat Samples
text: can load ‘irpeat’ R : can test ‘irpeat’ sample data R package ‘ir’: ir::ir_sample_data contains various ATR-MIR spectra organic reference material (e.g. newspaper, wood, grass). simple workflow , example, baseline correct spectra (using functions package ‘ir’) compute various humification indices Klason lignin holocellulose mass fractions samples. use first spectra ir::ir_sample_data speed computations bit . x identical ir::ir_sample_data[1:10, ], contains additional columns computed humification indices (h1, h2, h3, h4) computed Klason lignin content (klason_lignin_2) Plot humification index (ratio intensities 1420 1090 cm-1 (Broder et al. 2012)) versus Klason lignin content:  computed quantities come units standard errors (thanks quantities package):

… with 48 more rows, and 2 more variables: holocellulose <units>, #> #   spectra <named list> x <-    ir::ir_sample_data[1:10, ] %>%                                # data   ir::ir_bc(method = "rubberband") %>%                          # baseline correction   irpeat::irp_hi() %>%                                          # humification indices   irpeat::irp_klason_lignin_2(do_summary = TRUE)                # Klason lignin content x #> # what: irpeat: Functions to Analyze Mid Infrared Spectra of Peat Samples — irpeat-package
title: irpeat: Functions to Analyze Mid Infrared Spectra of Peat Samples — irpeat-package
text: 'irpeat' provides functions analyze mid infrared spectra peat samples (various humification indices, Klason lignin content, holocellulose content, electron accepting capacity, electron donating capacity).

text: Maintainer: Henning Teickner henning.teickner@uni-muenster.de (ORCID) contributors: Suzanne B. Hodgkins hodgkins.3@osu.edu [contributor] Chuanyu Gao gaochuanyu@iga.ac.cn [contributor] Klaus-Holger Knorr kh.knorrr@wwu.de [contributor]

what: Computes contents of components of peat from mid infrared spectra — irp_content
title: Computes contents of components of peat from mid infrared spectra — irp_content
text: irp_content computes contents various components peat mid infrared spectra peat samples. functions may also work organic matter general. Note function wrapper function several individual functions irpeat. irp_content warnings messages regarding issues data suppressed nothing exported disk. case doubt, use corresponding functions warnings activated.

title: Computes contents of components of peat from mid infrared spectra — irp_content
Computes contents of components of peat from mid infrared spectra — irp_content
text: x object class ir. variable character vector one values define components contents computed spectra x. Currently allowed values : "" irp_content computes values . "klason_lignin_hodgkins" Klason lignin mass fraction [g/g] computed irp_content_klh_hodgkins(). "holocellulose_hodgkins" Holocellulose mass fraction [g/g] computed irp_content_klh_hodgkins(). "klason_lignin_2" Klason lignin mass fraction [g/g] computed irp_klason_lignin_2(). "holocellulose_2" Holocellulose mass fraction [g/g] computed irp_holocellulose_2(). "eac_1" Electron accepting capacity computed irp_eac_1(). "edc_1" Electron donating capacity computed irp_edc_1(). ... arguments passed individual prediction functions.

title: Computes contents of components of peat from mid infrared spectra — irp_content
text: object class ir additional columns containing predictions spectra x.

title: Computes contents of components of peat from mid infrared spectra — irp_content

what: Compute humification indices from mid infrared spectra — irp_hi
title: Compute humification indices from mid infrared spectra — irp_hi
text: irp_hi computes either custom humification indices predefined set humification indices reported Broder et al. (2012)  mid infrared spectra x values representing wavenumber values (checks performed) (see details section humification indices computed default). humification index ratio intensity values two different x axis values (e.g. wavenumbers) defined : $$   HI = \frac{y_x1}{y_x2} $$, \(y_x1\) intensity spectrum x axis value \(x1\) \(y_x2\) intensity spectrum x axis value \(x2\).

title: Compute humification indices from mid infrared spectra — irp_hi
Compute humification indices from mid infrared spectra — irp_hi
text: x object class ir. x1 numeric vector values representing x axis values spectra x. \(x1\) equation displayed . multiple humification indices x2 computed, x1 can contain multiple values. x1 = NULL, default humification indices computed (see details section). x2 numeric value representing x axis value spectra x. \(x2\) equation displayed . x2 = NULL, default humification indices computed (see details section).

title: Compute humification indices from mid infrared spectra — irp_hi
text: object class ir additional columns additional humification indices. x1 = NULL x2 = NULL, four new columns (hi1, hi2, hi3 hi4) correspond humification indices defined details section. x1 x2 NULL, columns names "hi_x1_x2" x1 x2 replaced respective values.

title: Compute humification indices from mid infrared spectra — irp_hi
text: following humification indices computed default (x1 = NULL x2 = NULL) (values represent wavenumbers [cm\(^{-1}\)]) (Broder et al. 2012)  : hi1: 1420/1090 OH CO phenols CH CH_1 CH_3 groups (phenolic aliphatic structures)/polysaccharides hi2: 1510/1090 Aromatic C=C C=O amides/polysaccharides hi3: 1630/1090 Aromatic C=C COO\(^{-1}\) (aromatics aromatic aliphatic carboxylates)/polysaccharides hi4: 1720/1090 carbonylic carboxylic C=O (carboxylic acids aromatic esters)/polysaccharides

title: Compute humification indices from mid infrared spectra — irp_hi
text: Broder T, Blodau C, Biester H, Knorr KH (2012). “Peat decomposition records three pristine ombrotrophic bogs southern Patagonia.” Biogeosciences, 9(4), 1479--1491. doi:10.5194/bg-9-1479-2012 .

title: Compute humification indices from mid infrared spectra — irp_hi
code: # get sample data library(ir)  # compute default humification indices d <- ir_sample_data[1:5, ] d <- irp_hi(d)  # compute custom humification index d <- ir_sample_data d <- irp_hi(d, x1 = 2900, x2 = 1090)  # compute custom humification indices d <- ir_sample_data d <- irp_hi(d, x1 = c(2900, 1630), x2 = 1090)
